name: barbarously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is extremely cruel or unpleasant, or that fails to reach acceptable social standards: The princess was kept as a prisoner in the castle of a barbarously evil villain. The dictator ruled with an iron fist and punished all dissidents barbarously.
More examplesFewer examplesHow could you love someone who has treated you so barbarously?Many years ago, a young couple was barbarously murdered while walking along that trail. The invading army ransacked the city and barbarously vandalized its places of worship.
